responsibilities: Apply data engineering skillset on fixed income data, including data processing, cleaning, outliers detection, and data warehouse maintaining.
Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability.
Test ideas on efficient data query, develop analytical tools and programs, and work with traders, data scientists, and engineers to evaluate business needs and objectives.
Work on specified projects and varied assignments.
Work independently on assigned projects and tasks, meeting all delivery deadlines.
Operate standard office equipment and use required software applications.
Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
skills: Programming: SQL, Python (Required). R/Java/C++ is a plus.
Analyzing large quantities of raw data with a detail-oriented approach.
Data collecting/cleaning; preparing data for prescriptive and predictive modeling.
Operating standard office equipment and using, or having the ability to learn, required software applications.
Ability to work effectively as part of a virtual/hybrid team.
Hands-on experience with Oracle database is preferred.
Ability to organize and prioritize multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
Ability to provide a high level of customer service.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
qualifications: Must be currently pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, data science, or related field.
Any equivalent combination of experience, education, and/or training approved by Human Resources.
